lead_paragraph: A male California condor has flown back into the wild after a captive breeding program that helped save North America’s largest species of land bird.
snippet: A male California condor has flown back into the wild after a captive breeding program that helped save North America’s largest species of land bird.

headline.main: California: Father to Many, Condor Is Set Free
headline.print_headline: California: Father to Many, Condor Is Set Free After 30 Years

abstract: Male California condor named AC-4 is released from Bitter Creek National Wildlife Refuge; AC-4 was part of successful captive breeding program by Fish and Wildlife Service that saved species from extinction; AC-4 fathered 30 chicks, all of which were successfully released into wild.
